issues.description: Return type mismatch for Farm.singFarmSong(): The UML in the problem statement specifies + singFarmSong():void and the template declares public void singFarmSong(), i.e. the method should print the song. The solution repository instead implements public String singFarmSong() that returns the song text. This divergence in return type/behavior (printing vs. returning a String) is structural: students following the problem and template will implement a void method that prints, while the reference solution uses a String-returning method. This can confuse students and break or change how tests expect output (printing vs. returned value).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method signature consistent across artifacts. Either (A) change the solution to public void singFarmSong() and have it print the song (matching the UML and template), or (B) update the problem statement and template to specify public String singFarmSong() and document that the method should return the whole song text (and adjust any tests accordingly). Prefer (A) to preserve the original specification that the method prints the song.

issues.description: Return type mismatch for Farm.singFarmSongVerse(Animal): The UML in the problem shows a private singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal):void (a private helper that prints a verse). The template declares a private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/) (parameter commented out), consistent with the UML. The solution instead implements private String singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) that returns a verse String. This is a structural inconsistency (void/printing vs. String/returning) between the problem/template and the solution and may confuse students about the intended helper method contract and printing behavior.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the helper method contract across artifacts. Either (A) change the solution's singFarmSongVerse to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) and have it print the verse directly (matching UML/template), or (B) update the problem statement and template to specify a private String singFarmSongVerse(Animal) that returns the verse, and document whether singFarmSong prints or returns the combined verses. Prefer (A) to match the existing UML and template intent.

issues.description: The UML and template expect singFarmSong() and singFarmSongVerse(Animal) to be void methods that print the song (Problem statement/UML and template Farm.java). In the provided solution, both methods return String and build/return the song text (solution Farm.java). Although the method names match, the difference in return type and observable behavior (printing vs. returning a String) creates a mismatch between the problem/template expectations and the reference implementation. Students following the problem and template will implement printing (void) methods, but the solution returns strings — this can cause confusion about the intended API/behavior and may lead to failing tests or extra work reconciling printing vs. returning the song.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the API/behavior consistent across artifacts. Either (A) change the solution to match the UML/template by making singFarmSong() a public void that prints the song and making singFarmSongVerse(Animal) a private void that prints the verse directly, or (B) update the UML and template to indicate that singFarmSong() returns a String (and adjust template method stubs and task text to describe returning the song instead of printing). Option A (align solution to void/printing as described in the problem/UML) is the least disruptive for students following the current exercise text.
